A very nice park for kids. Slides and other swings available here. The toy train is there which charges Rs 50. Trees and plants there bring serenity in this park which gives relaxation and enjoyment with family. Selfie point is there with ' I love Barmer'. Gym related equipment installed for warm-ups. Outside you will get refreshments of sugarcane juice, paani puri and other snacks.

reviews.text:
1) It's a temple of jogmaya mata.
2) It's a second highest temple in Barmer, after sujesvar temple (temple of shiv bhagwan).
3) I got peace of mind after reaching this temple, you would also get.
4) I got the whole view of Barmer at the top of this temple.
5) Facility of drinking water was also available.
6) I got Prasad nearby to temple.

************************

Barmer Fort occupies an unrivalled place as Rajasthan’s oldest fort. Located on a steep hill, this fort was built by Rawat Bhima in 1552 AD after he moved to this place from Juna. The hill over which the fort is located is as high as 1383 feet. However, Rawat Bhima got Barmer Garh established at a height of 676 feet to make it safer. The road to the fort is quite narrow; nonetheless, it offers rewarding sights of the region.
The main entrance gate of Barmer Fort is from north gate, whereas the safety walls are made towards the east and west gate. Next to the fort is Jogmaya Devi temple which is also known as Garh Mandir. Another shrine located on the same hill is Nagnechi Mata Mandir. Both the temples exude peace and positive vibes, and a mela is held every year at these shrines during the nine holy nights of Navratri. A nominal fee has to be paid to reach Barmer Garh.

reviews.text: This is the first time I'm visiting this temple of lord Siva.

Amazing palce nearby Barmer city area.
This place is so soulful and peaceful.
And one thing is also fascinating that's greenery around here. And the small pond is also very awesome. You can find a lot off lotas in mid water. here's a temple and a garden also. So this place is perfect for family picnic and hangout with friends.

Its a hidden treasure in Barmer. It is unbelievable to find such a beautiful pond filled with lotus and variety of fish in Barmer. People often visit here performing rituals, feed the fish in the pond or to enjoy the sunset view from here.

Jasder dham is situated on badmer jodhpur highway near dto office badmer. hare built many temples but main temple is of lord shiva. here a big pond also.number of fishes,bagulas, lives here. there is a park also. peaple visit there for worship lord shiva. and enjoying in park. this is a good picnic spot near barmer city.

reviews.text:
Barmer is a soothing city of Rajasthan.
A pollution free city ranked in world wide category.
Helpful behaviour of everyone.
Evening's are still natural there.
There is no need of any fan or cooler in night life if you are sleeping in open sky under star's ⭐⭐✨✨.

Barmer is a district located in the western state of Rajasthan, India. It is known for its rich cultural heritage, vibrant folk music, and colorful festivals. The district is also home to some of the most beautiful and historic places in Rajasthan.

One of the most popular tourist attractions in Barmer is the Barmer Fort. Built in the 16th century, the fort is a stunning example of Rajasthani architecture and offers breathtaking views of the surrounding desert landscape. Another must-visit destination in Barmer is the Kiradu Temples. These ancient temples are dedicated to Lord Shiva and are believed to have been built in the 11th century.

Barmer is also famous for its rich and vibrant culture. The district is home to several traditional folk music forms such as the Ghoomar and Kalbeliya dance forms. The district also hosts several colorful festivals throughout the year, including the Barmer Thar Festival, which celebrates the rich cultural heritage of the region.

In addition to its cultural attractions, Barmer also offers visitors a chance to experience the beauty of Rajasthan's natural landscape. The district is home to several wildlife sanctuaries and national parks, including the Desert National Park and the Jawai Leopard Safari. These parks offer visitors a chance to see some of Rajasthan's most iconic wildlife, including leopards, desert foxes, and chinkaras.

Overall, Barmer is a must-visit destination for anyone looking to experience the rich culture and natural beauty of Rajasthan. With its stunning historical sites, vibrant culture, and breathtaking natural landscapes, Barmer is truly a gem of Rajasthan.
